intro: Adesmia digitata, commonly known as the slender burrpea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant features small, yellow flowers that are clustered in spikes, and its leaves are usually narrow and hairy. Adesmia digitata has a woody stem with small, spiny branches, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils.
